types.name: GameCoverSize
types.description: The size of the game cover. Game covers are downsized to fit within the specified dimensions while retaining the original aspect ratio. Will only resize the image if it's larger than the specified dimensions.

enumValues.name: SMALL
enumValues.description: Game cover image with a maximum width of 200 and maximum height of 300.

enumValues.name: MEDIUM
enumValues.description: Game cover image with a maximum width of 300 and maximum height of 500.

enumValues.name: LARGE
enumValues.description: Game cover image with a maximum width of 500 and maximum height of 800.

types.name: GamePurchaseCompletionStatus
types.description: Completion Status options for game purchases (games in a user's library).

enumValues.name: UNPLAYED
enumValues.description: The game is unplayed.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: The game is currently being played.

enumValues.name: DROPPED
enumValues.description: The game was dropped without being completed.

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: The game has been completed.

enumValues.name: FULLY_COMPLETED
enumValues.description: The game is 100% complete, e.g. with all achievements unlocked.

enumValues.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
enumValues.description: The game cannot be completed.

enumValues.name: PAUSED
enumValues.description: The game is incomplete and not being played, but the user intends to come back to play it again later.

enumValues.name: NEWEST
enumValues.description: Sorted with newest game records first.

enumValues.name: OLDEST
enumValues.description: Sorted with newest game records last.

enumValues.name: RECENTLY_UPDATED
enumValues.description: Sorted with most recently updated game records first.

enumValues.name: LEAST_RECENTLY_UPDATED
enumValues.description: Sorted with most recently updated game records last.

enumValues.name: MOST_FAVORITES
enumValues.description: Sorted by the games that have been favorited the most times.

enumValues.name: MOST_OWNERS
enumValues.description: Sorted by the games that are in the most users' libraries.

enumValues.name: RECENTLY_RELEASED
enumValues.description: Sorted with the games that were most recently released first.

enumValues.name: HIGHEST_AVG_RATING
enumValues.description: Sorted by the games that have the highest average rating.

types.name: ID
types.description: Represents a unique identifier that is Base64 obfuscated. It is often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"VXNlci0xMA=="`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: Mutations are GraphQL requests that can be used to create, update, or delete records on vglist.

fields.name: globalSearch
fields.description:
Search for records matching a given string. Returns Companies, Engines,
Games, Genres, Platforms, Series', and Users.

Please always debounce/throttle requests to this endpoint. There's no
reason to send a request for every letter a user types.

args.name: query
args.description: The query to search for records with.

args.name: searchableTypes
args.description: The types of records that multisearch should return. By default, it will return all types of searchable records.

args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

Entries in the Steam Blocklist, for blocking the creation of games with a
given Steam App ID. Mainly used for things we don't want to track, such
as DLC or non-game Steam applications.

fields.name: user
fields.description: User that created this blocklist entry, can be null if the user deleted their account.

args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

fields.name: gamePurchases
fields.description: Games in this user's library.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the user.

fields.name: isFollowed
fields.description: Whether the current user is following this user. `null` if there is no logged-in user or the current user is querying on themselves.

fields.name: privacy
fields.description: The user's level of privacy.

fields.name: role
fields.description: User permission level.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The user's slug, used for their profile URL.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When this user was last updated.

fields.name: username
fields.description: Username of the user.

types.name: UserAvatarSize
types.description: The size of the user avatar.

enumValues.name: SMALL
enumValues.description: User avatar image with a width of 80 and height of 80.

enumValues.name: MEDIUM
enumValues.description: User avatar image with a width of 150 and height of 150.

enumValues.name: LARGE
enumValues.description: User avatar image with a width of 300 and height of 300.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The total number of records returned by this query.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: UserPrivacy
types.description: An enum describing the privacy level of a given user. Most users will be `PUBLIC_ACCOUNT`.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC_ACCOUNT
enumValues.description: User has a publicly-visible profile.

enumValues.name: PRIVATE_ACCOUNT
enumValues.description: User has a private profile.

types.name: UserRole
types.description: Roles that a user can have, these define permissions levels. Most users will be `MEMBER`.

enumValues.name: MEMBER
enumValues.description: User is a regular user.

enumValues.name: MODERATOR
enumValues.description: User has some heightened permissions.

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: User is an admin and has the highest permissions.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: URL for the user's avatar image. `null` means the user has the default avatar.

args.name: size
args.description: The size of the avatar image being requested.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The contents of the search result, typically the name or username of the corresponding record.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the SearchResult record, probably not very useful most of the time.

fields.name: searchableId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding record, e.g. the Game ID.

fields.name: searchableType
fields.description: The type of the corresponding record.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug for usage defining the user's profile URL.

enumValues.name: MOST_GAMES
enumValues.description: Sorted by the number of games in the given user's library.

enumValues.name: MOST_FOLLOWERS
enumValues.description: Sorted by the number of users following the given user.

types.name: WikidataBlocklistEntry
types.description:
Entries in the Wikidata Blocklist, for blocking the creation of games
with a given Wikidata ID. Mainly used for things we don't want to track,
such as DLC or things that aren't _really_ games but are declared as
games in Wikidata.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When this blocklist entry was first created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the Wikidata Blocklist entry.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the game that has been blocked.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When this blocklist entry was last updated.

fields.name: user
fields.description: User that created this blocklist entry, can be null if the user deleted their account.

fields.name: wikidataId
fields.description: The blocked Wikidata ID.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The total number of records returned by this query.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
